item.title: Carly add a quote by Nicholas A. Basbanes
item.description: "With thought, patience, and discrimination, book passion becomes the signature of a person's character. " -- Nicholas A. Basbanes

item.title: Carly add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "In the sunset of dissolution, everything is illuminated by the aura of nostalgia, even the guillotine." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Carly add a quote by John Updike
item.description: "You do things and do things and nobody really has a clue." -- John Updike

item.title: Carly add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description:
"Thermodynamic miracles... events with odds against so astronomical they're effectively impossible, like oxygen spontaneously becoming gold. I long to observe such a thing. And yet, in each human coupling, a thousand million sperm vie for a single egg. Multiply those odds by countless generations, against the odds of your ancestors being alive; meeting; siring this precise son; that exact daughter... Until your mother loves a man she has every reason to hate, and of that union, of the thousand million children competing for fertilization, it was you, only you, that emerged. To distill so specific a form from that chaos of improbability, like turning air to gold... that is the crowning unlikelihood. The thermodynamic miracle.
But...if me, my birth, if that's a thermodynamic miracle... I mean, you could say that about anybody in the world!.
Yes. Anybody in the world. ..But the world is so full of people, so crowded with these miracles that they become commonplace and we forget... I forget. We gaze continually at the world and it grows dull in our perceptions. Yet seen from the another's vantage point. As if new, it may still take our breath away. Come...dry your eyes. For you are life, rarer than a quark and unpredictable beyond the dreams of Heisenberg; the clay in which the forces that shape all things leave their fingerprints most clearly. Dry your eyes... and let's go home." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Carly add a quote by Karen Armstrong
item.description: "A personalized God can be a mere idol carved in our own image- a projection of our limited needs, fears, and desires. We can assume that he loves what we love and hates what we hate, endorsing our prejudices instead of compelling us to transcend them. When he seems to fail to prevent a catastrophe or seems even to desire a tragedy, he can seem callous and cruel. A facile belief that a disaster is the will of God can make us accept things that are fundamentally unacceptable. The very fact, as a person, God has a gender is also limiting: It means that the sexuality of half the human race is sacralized at the expense of the female and can lead to neurotic and inadequate imbalance in human sexual mores. A personal God can be dangerous, therefore. Instead of pulling us beyond our limitations, “he” can encourage us to remain complacently within them; “he” can make us cruel, callous, self-satisfied and partial as “he” seems to be. Instead of inspiring the compassion that should characterize all advanced religions, “he” can encourage us to judge, condemn, and marginalize." -- Karen Armstrong

item.title: Carly add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "Be thankful that you have a life, and forsake your vain and presumptuous desire for a second one." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Carly add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "The only watchmaker is the blind forces of physics." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Carly add a quote by Thornton Wilder
item.description: "I think that it can be assumed that no adults are ever really 'shocked' - that being shocked is always a pose." -- Thornton Wilder

item.title: Carly add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Whatever in creation exists without my knowledge exists without my consent." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Carly add a quote by Adam Ross
item.description: "You know, as I've grown older, my ideas about sin have changed. I used to believe that sins were things you did, but I don't think that now. I think sins are what you ignore." -- Adam Ross

item.title: Carly add a quote by Paul Auster
item.description: "It seems to me that I will always be happy in the place where I am not." -- Paul Auster

item.title: Carly add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "What he needed was to find fifty more people like him, who had stopped being themselves without realizing it." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Carly add a quote by Richard P. Feynman
item.description: "I think it's much more interesting to live not knowing than to have answers which might be wrong." -- Richard P. Feynman

item.title: Carly add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Carly add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "God is a comedian playing to an audience that is too afraid to laugh." -- Voltaire

item.title: Carly add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities." -- Voltaire

item.title: Carly add a quote by Adam Smith
item.description: "It is not very unreasonable that the rich should contribute to the public expense, not only in proportion to their revenue, but something more than in that proportion." -- Adam Smith

item.title: Carly add a quote by Adam Smith
item.description: "Virtue is more to be feared than vice, because its excesses are not subject to the regulation of conscience." -- Adam Smith

item.title: Carly add a quote by Adam Smith
item.description: "Civil government, so far as it is instituted for the security of property, is in reality instituted for the defense of the rich against the poor, or of those who have some property against those who have none at all." -- Adam Smith

item.title: Carly add a quote by Adam Smith
item.description: "Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition." -- Adam Smith

item.title: Carly add a quote by Richard Ford
item.description: "Cynicism makes you feel smart, I know it, even when you aren't smart." -- Richard Ford

item.title: Carly add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Carly add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "You've got to work with your mistakes until they look intended. Understand?" -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Carly add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor
